page.title: 04THE RIDINGS SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content: The main shopping areas in Wakefield are the pedestrian precinct, the indoor and outdoor markets and the newly opened{Ridings Centre.}The centre was started in 1981 and opened in 1984. There are over 100 different shops which include a public house, a major supermarket and other nationally known shops such as Mothercare, C & A, Marks and Spencer, British Home Stores and W.H.Smith. Shopping is on three different levels and because of the centres proximity to Wakefield Cathedral these have been named{All {Saints Walk, Bishopgate Walk}and {Cathedral Walk.}Perhaps the most attractive feature of the Ridings development is the central glass wall climber lift. Indoor gardens, a food court, a play centre for young children all combine to make this a very important feature of Wakefield.
